required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial of CSL's 2009 H1N1 Influenza Vaccine (CSL425) in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Single-centre, Randomised, Observer-blind Study to Evaluate the Immunogenicity, Safety and Tolerability of CSL's Monovalent H1N1 Influenza Virus Vaccine in Healthy Adults Aged 18 to < 65 Years.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine whether CSL425 is a safe and effective vaccine for eliciting an immune response to H1N1 influenza in healthy adults.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Haemagglutination Inhibition (HI) and Microneutralisation (MN) Antibody Titre Seroconversion Rate After the First Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the first vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination antibody titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre.

primary_outcome.measure: HI and MN Antibody Titre Seroconversion Rate After the Second Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination antibody titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Increase (GMFI) in the HI and MN Antibody Titre After the First Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the first vaccination
primary_outcome.description: GMFI in antibody titre was defined as the geometric mean of the fold increase in the post-vaccination antibody titre over the pre-vaccination antibody titre.

primary_outcome.measure: GMFI in the HI and MN Antibody Titer After the Second Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: GMFI in antibody titre was defined as the geometric mean of the fold increase in the post-vaccination antibody titre over the pre-vaccination antibody titre.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a HI or MN Antibody Titre of 1:40 or More After the First Vaccination
Percentage of Participants Achieving a HI or MN Antibody Titre of 1:40 or More After the Second Vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: HI and MN Antibody Titre Seroconversion Rate After the First Vaccination by Age Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the first vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination antibody titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre. Adults were aged from 18 to 49 years; Older adults were aged from 50 to 64 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: HI and MN Antibody Titre Seroconversion Rate After the Second Vaccination by Age Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the second vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination antibody titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre. Adults were aged from 18 to 49 years; Older adults were aged from 50 to 64 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: GMFI in the HI and MN Antibody Titre After the First Vaccination by Age Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the first vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: GMFI in antibody titre was defined as the geometric mean of the fold increase in the post-vaccination antibody titre over the pre-vaccination antibody titre. Adults were aged from 18 to 49 years; Older adults were aged from 50 to 64 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: GMFI in the HI and MN Antibody Titre After the Second Vaccination by Age Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the second vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: GMFI in antibody titre was defined as the geometric mean of the fold increase in the post-vaccination antibody titre over the pre-vaccination antibody titre. Adults were aged from 18 to 49 years; Older adults were aged from 50 to 64 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a HI or MN Antibody Titre of 1:40 or More After the First Vaccination by Age Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 21 days after the first vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Adults were aged from 18 to 49 years; Older adults were aged from 50 to 64 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a HI or MN Antibody Titre of 1:40 or More After the Second Vaccination by Age Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 21 days after the second vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Adults were aged from 18 to 49 years; Older adults were aged from 50 to 64 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Baseline Titre Less Than 1:10 Achieving Seroconversion After Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after each vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with a baseline titre less than 1:10 differed according to antibody assay (HI or MN) and is shown in the category titles accordingly. The total number of participants analysed includes all evaluable participants; however, the analysis is stratified by baseline titre and those participants with a baseline titre less than 1:10 are presented in this outcome measure while those with a baseline titre of 1:10 or more are presented in a separate outcome measure. Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Baseline Titre Greater Than or Equal to 1:10 Achieving Seroconversion After Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after each vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with a baseline titre greater than or equal to 1:10 differed according to antibody assay (HI or MN) and is shown in the category titles accordingly. The total number of participants analysed includes all evaluable participants; however, the analysis is stratified by baseline titre and those participants with a baseline titre of 1:10 or more are presented in this outcome measure while those with a baseline titre less than 1:10 are presented in a separate outcome measure. Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre (ie, a significant increase in antibody titre after vaccination).

secondary_outcome.measure: GMFI in the HI Antibody Titre 180 Days After the Second Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 21 days and 180 days after the second vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: The GMFI in antibody titre was calculated by taking the anti-logs of the means of the log transformed fold-increases in the antibody titre 180 days after the second vaccination over the antibody titre 21 days after the second vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a HI Antibody Titre of 1:40 or More 180 Days After the Second Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days after the second vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Solicited Local Adverse Events (AEs) After the First Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the first vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for. Grade 3 solicited AE definitions: Prevented normal daily activities; Size > 100 mm for injection site redness, induration/swelling, and bruising.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Solicited Local AEs After the First Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the first vaccination and up to Day 20 after the first vaccination if AE is ongoing at Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Solicited Local AEs After the Second Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the second vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for. Grade 3 solicited AE definitions: Prevented normal daily activities; Size > 100 mm for injection site redness, induration/swelling, and bruising.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Solicited Local AEs After the Second Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the second vaccination and up to Day 20 after the second vaccination if AE is ongoing at Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Solicited Systemic AEs After the First Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the first vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for. Grade 3 solicited AE definitions: Prevented normal daily activities; Temperature 102.2°F (39.0°C) or more for fevers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Solicited Systemic AEs After the First Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the first vaccination and up to Day 20 after the first vaccination if AE is ongoing at Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Solicited Systemic AEs After the Second Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the second vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for. Grade 3 solicited AE definitions: Prevented normal daily activities; Temperature 102.2°F (39.0°C) or more for fevers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Solicited Systemic AEs After the Second Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the second vaccination and up to Day 20 after the second vaccination if AE is ongoing at Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESIs), and New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 180 days after the last vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: An AESI was defined as an AE for which the association with seasonal influenza vaccine was unclear. A NOCI was defined as the diagnosis of a new medical condition that was chronic in nature, including those potentially controllable by medication (eg, diabetes, asthma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Unsolicited AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 20 after vaccination; up to 180 days after the last vaccination for SAEs, AESIs, and NOCIs
secondary_outcome.description: Unsolicited AEs included AEs other than those specifically sought for. The grading definitions were: Mild (Grade 1): Symptoms were easily tolerated and did not interfere with daily activities. Moderate (Grade 2): Enough discomfort to cause some interference with daily activities. Severe (Grade 3): Incapacitating, with inability to work or do usual activities.

clinical_study.condition: Influenza Caused by the Novel Influenza A (H1N1) Virus

arm_group.description: 15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.25 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21
30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.5 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female aged >= 18 to < 65 years at the time of providing informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to a previous dose of influenza virus vaccine or allergy to eggs, chicken protein, thiomersal, neomycin, polymyxin, or any components of the Study Vaccine.

results_reference.citation: Greenberg ME, Lai MH, Hartel GF, Wichems CH, Gittleson C, Bennet J, Dawson G, Hu W, Leggio C, Washington D, Basser RL. Response to a monovalent 2009 influenza A (H1N1) vaccine. N Engl J Med. 2009 Dec 17;361(25):2405-13. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa0907413. Epub 2009 Sep 10.

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg)
group.description: 15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.25 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg)
group.description: 30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.5 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg)
group.description: 15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.25 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg)
group.description: 30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.5 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male

outcome.title: Haemagglutination Inhibition (HI) and Microneutralisation (MN) Antibody Titre Seroconversion Rate After the First Vaccination
outcome.description: Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination antibody titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre.
outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the first vaccination
outcome.population: The Evaluable Population (for the first vaccination) comprised all randomised participants who received the first study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

measure.title: GMFI in the HI and MN Antibody Titre After the Second Vaccination by Age Group
measure.description: GMFI in antibody titre was defined as the geometric mean of the fold increase in the post-vaccination antibody titre over the pre-vaccination antibody titre. Adults were aged from 18 to 49 years; Older adults were aged from 50 to 64 years.
measure.population: The Evaluable Population (for the second vaccination) comprised all randomised participants who received the second study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a HI or MN Antibody Titre of 1:40 or More After the First Vaccination by Age Group
outcome.description: Adults were aged from 18 to 49 years; Older adults were aged from 50 to 64 years.
outcome.time_frame: 21 days after the first vaccination
outcome.population: The Evaluable Population (for the first vaccination) comprised all randomised participants who received the first study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a HI or MN Antibody Titre of 1:40 or More After the Second Vaccination by Age Group
measure.description: Adults were aged from 18 to 49 years; Older adults were aged from 50 to 64 years.
measure.population: The Evaluable Population (for the second vaccination) comprised all randomised participants who received the second study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Baseline Titre Less Than 1:10 Achieving Seroconversion After Vaccination
outcome.description: The number of participants with a baseline titre less than 1:10 differed according to antibody assay (HI or MN) and is shown in the category titles accordingly. The total number of participants analysed includes all evaluable participants; however, the analysis is stratified by baseline titre and those participants with a baseline titre less than 1:10 are presented in this outcome measure while those with a baseline titre of 1:10 or more are presented in a separate outcome measure. Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre.
outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after each vaccination
outcome.population: The Evaluable Population comprised all randomised participants who received the first (or second, as appropriate) study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg)
group.description: 15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.25 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg)
group.description: 30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.5 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Baseline Titre Less Than 1:10 Achieving Seroconversion After Vaccination
measure.description: The number of participants with a baseline titre less than 1:10 differed according to antibody assay (HI or MN) and is shown in the category titles accordingly. The total number of participants analysed includes all evaluable participants; however, the analysis is stratified by baseline titre and those participants with a baseline titre less than 1:10 are presented in this outcome measure while those with a baseline titre of 1:10 or more are presented in a separate outcome measure. Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre.
measure.population: The Evaluable Population comprised all randomised participants who received the first (or second, as appropriate) study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Baseline Titre Greater Than or Equal to 1:10 Achieving Seroconversion After Vaccination
outcome.description: The number of participants with a baseline titre greater than or equal to 1:10 differed according to antibody assay (HI or MN) and is shown in the category titles accordingly. The total number of participants analysed includes all evaluable participants; however, the analysis is stratified by baseline titre and those participants with a baseline titre of 1:10 or more are presented in this outcome measure while those with a baseline titre less than 1:10 are presented in a separate outcome measure. Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre (ie, a significant increase in antibody titre after vaccination).
outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after each vaccination
outcome.population: The Evaluable Population comprised all randomised participants who received the study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg)
group.description: 15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.25 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg)
group.description: 30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.5 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Baseline Titre Greater Than or Equal to 1:10 Achieving Seroconversion After Vaccination
measure.description: The number of participants with a baseline titre greater than or equal to 1:10 differed according to antibody assay (HI or MN) and is shown in the category titles accordingly. The total number of participants analysed includes all evaluable participants; however, the analysis is stratified by baseline titre and those participants with a baseline titre of 1:10 or more are presented in this outcome measure while those with a baseline titre less than 1:10 are presented in a separate outcome measure. Antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre (ie, a significant increase in antibody titre after vaccination).
measure.population: The Evaluable Population comprised all randomised participants who received the study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

outcome.title: GMFI in the HI Antibody Titre 180 Days After the Second Vaccination
outcome.description: The GMFI in antibody titre was calculated by taking the anti-logs of the means of the log transformed fold-increases in the antibody titre 180 days after the second vaccination over the antibody titre 21 days after the second vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: 21 days and 180 days after the second vaccination
outcome.population: The Evaluable Population comprised all randomised participants who received the second study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

outcome.title: Frequency and Intensity of Solicited Local Adverse Events (AEs) After the First Vaccination
outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for. Grade 3 solicited AE definitions: Prevented normal daily activities; Size > 100 mm for injection site redness, induration/swelling, and bruising.
outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the first vaccination
outcome.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg)
group.description: 15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.25 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg)
group.description: 30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.5 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

measure.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

outcome.title: Duration of Solicited Local AEs After the First Vaccination
outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for.
outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 6 after the first vaccination and up to Day 20 after the first vaccination if AE is ongoing at Day 7
outcome.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

outcome.title: Incidence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESIs), and New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
outcome.description: An AESI was defined as an AE for which the association with seasonal influenza vaccine was unclear. A NOCI was defined as the diagnosis of a new medical condition that was chronic in nature, including those potentially controllable by medication (eg, diabetes, asthma).
outcome.time_frame: Up to 180 days after the last vaccination
outcome.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg)
group.description: 15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.25 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg)
group.description: 30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.5 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

measure.title: Incidence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESIs), and New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
measure.description: An AESI was defined as an AE for which the association with seasonal influenza vaccine was unclear. A NOCI was defined as the diagnosis of a new medical condition that was chronic in nature, including those potentially controllable by medication (eg, diabetes, asthma).
measure.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

outcome.title: Frequency and Intensity of Unsolicited AEs
outcome.description: Unsolicited AEs included AEs other than those specifically sought for. The grading definitions were: Mild (Grade 1): Symptoms were easily tolerated and did not interfere with daily activities. Moderate (Grade 2): Enough discomfort to cause some interference with daily activities. Severe (Grade 3): Incapacitating, with inability to work or do usual activities.
outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 20 after vaccination; up to 180 days after the last vaccination for SAEs, AESIs, and NOCIs
outcome.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg)
group.description: 15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.25 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg)
group.description: 30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.5 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

measure.title: Frequency and Intensity of Unsolicited AEs
measure.description: Unsolicited AEs included AEs other than those specifically sought for. The grading definitions were: Mild (Grade 1): Symptoms were easily tolerated and did not interfere with daily activities. Moderate (Grade 2): Enough discomfort to cause some interference with daily activities. Severe (Grade 3): Incapacitating, with inability to work or do usual activities.
measure.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

reported_events.time_frame: For SAEs: up to 180 days after the last vaccination. For Other AEs: solicited AEs: from Day 0 to Day 6 after each vaccination; unsolicited AEs: from Day 0 to Day 20 after each vaccination; up to 180 days after the last vaccination for AESIs and NOCIs.
reported_events.desc: Unsolicited AEs presented in the organ system "General disorders" with a footnote of "MedDRA 12.1", were collected under the MedDRA System Organ Class (SOC) 'General disorders and administration site conditions'. Solicited AEs are presented in the organ system "General disorders" and were not collected under the MedDRA SOC.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: CSL agreements and restrictions on publishing may vary with individual investigators; however, CSL will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. CSL supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial and generally requires that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
